# Copilot Instructions for nclsbayona.github.io

## File overview
This file contains instructions for GitHub Copilot to better understand the context of the repository and provide more relevant suggestions.

## Repository context
The repository is a personal blog built with Hugo, a static site generator. The content is primarily written in Markdown and located in the `content` directory. The site is deployed using GitHub Pages via GitHub Actions.

## Directories purpose
- `config/`: The main configuration for the Hugo site (These are related to the theme in use `github.com/CaiJimmy/hugo-theme-stack`).
- `content/`: Contains the blog posts and pages.
- `assets/`: Contains static assets like images, css and scripts.
- `layouts/`: Contains custom layouts and templates for the site.
- `.github/workflows/`: Contains GitHub Actions workflows for CI/CD.

## Blog focus
This personal blog focuses on topics related to software development, programming, technology trends, DevOps, DevSecOps and best-practices that can be used in these areas.

The owner of this blog likes to share knowledge, tutorials, and insights about the software development lifecycle, security practices, and modern development methodologies. Furthermore, the blog often discusses tools and techniques that can help developers and teams improve their workflows and code quality as well as their overall productivity. In addition to this, the blog is meant to give visibility into different options, tools and practices that can be used in the software development and DevOps/DevSecOps fields explaining the pros/cons of each one, comparing them and giving context-aware explanations for the use-cases of each.

## Copilot behavior guidelines
- When suggesting code or configurations, prioritize Hugo-specific solutions and best practices.
- Ensure that suggestions align with Hugo's templating language and best practices.
- Ensure that any suggested configurations or code snippets are compatible with GitHub Pages deployment.
- Ensure that suggestions respect the structure and organization of a Hugo-based blog.
- For blog content, focus on content that is relevant to software development, DevOps, and related topics.
- Maintain a professional and/or informative tone suitable for a technical blog but also approachable and engaging for readers.
- When suggesting configurations or code snippets, ensure they are compatible with the latest versions of Hugo and any relevant tools or libraries.
- Avoid suggesting deprecated practices or outdated information.
- When suggesting GitHub Actions workflows, ensure they follow best practices for security and efficiency.
- When suggesting content for blog posts, consider including practical examples, code snippets, and real-world applications to enhance the value for readers.
- Whenever possible, suggest ways to improve site performance, SEO, accessibility and user experience.
- Avoid suggesting any content or code that has been explicitly marked for ignoring in the recent edits.
- When asked for improvement on an existing blog post, consider the target audience and the technical depth appropriate for them (Include examples, diagrams, tables, references and visuals).
